text:
Hey Chris, please meet Alex your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Chris, nice to meet you!
Here's a small introduction so you could understand my background better.

I've been in VFX industry for over 7 years by now. Originally I'm Ukrainian and started my career in Kiev as a generalist. Quickly transitioned to modeling and then to lighting lookdev(because I'm not patient enough to model, I like to have immediate results :slightly_smiling_face: ) After a year in the best company in Kiev I moved to Prague,CZ because I was looking for a much higher level projects. To a certain extent I succeeded just because I could work on films like Warcraft and The Walk(Also gods of egypts... unfortunately :wink: )
So after another year I moved to Warsaw, PL to Platige image. It was a lot of fun working there even though it was all about game cinematic. Also I became a lead lighter/environments guy there. I brought  substance painter into pipeline(I'm really sorry junior texture artists who were rejected in getting a working there because of that) and developed some pipeline tools as well as led development team for a few months. And before leaving platige I became a CG sup as well and after 2 and a half years in total I moved to London.
Here I worked at MPC assets department(one of the best departments of MPC) as a lead lookdev with majority of team in Bangalore,India, and after a year in MPC I moved to Framestore London.
So I'm here to answer all you VFX related questions but of course I'm happy to chat about none related to VFX topics too.
Personally I really like playing games,watching films(lately almost exclusively in cinema), tv series(also only the best ones, don't have time for anything worse than Breaking bad or Chernobyl) and I truly love Japanese art.
I'm not sure about when and how often I'm gonna be available but we will figure this out along the way I guess. So feel free to write me any time but most likely I will be replying in bursts of long replies :slightly_smiling_face:
